title: ğŸ“’ nbdev-setup
text:
Instructions

Create a new repo on github and clone locally
Install nbdev


pip install nbdev * Linux/WSL only (as of Aug 2022)
* Note: pip install does work on windows, but some commands (i.e.Â doc building with Quarto) are unix only.


Create ğŸ“’ nbdev project from current repo



nbdev_new

settings.ini should update automatically with github config values.


Install git and Jupyter hooks for git-friendly notebooks



nbdev_install_hooks
nbdev_install_quarto local documents

Use nbdev_help for command list



image.png

title: ğŸ“’ nbdev-setup
text:
Development
Quick access command:

nbdev_prepare
nbdev_docs
git add -A; git commit -mâ€™check in filesâ€™; git push

Run jupyter notebook and add code using export tags

i.e.Â ğŸ“‘ [notebooks/00_core.ipynb]

title: ğŸ“’ nbdev-setup
text:
ğŸ—ï¸ nbdev_prepare
command bundles the following

ğŸ—ï¸ nbdev_export: Builds the .py modules and library from the jupyter notebook
ğŸ› ï¸ nbdev_test: Tests all your notebooks
ğŸš¿ nbdev_clean: Cleans your notebooks to get rid of extreanous output for Github

ğŸ“ To build docs from notebooks (including README.md from index.ipynb)

nbdev_docs


Install module locally using pip:

!pip install -e .

To use module inline:

from nbdev_setup.core import *


hello_player('Luke')

'Hello Luke! From 00_core.ipynb'
